newsitem.title: CHINA: China aims for 8.0 pct economic growth in 1997.
newsitem.headline: China aims for 8.0 pct economic growth in 1997.

text.p: China's Premier Li Peng set a target of 8.0 percent economic growth on Saturday in his annual government work report to the National People's Congress.
For China, that is a cautious target.
Li set a similar target last year but China's sizzling economy, spurred by Deng's market reforms launched 18 years ago, defied Li's caution to grow by 9.7 percent last year.

Li has been one of China's strongest proponents of slowing economic growth, albeit with limited success, following three years of double-digit increases in the early 1990s when the economy showed signs of overheating. The State Statistical Bureau has forecast 10.5 percent growth for this year.
